D0C43CA58C4D4A6481B226B5F5FB7AE7.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate.

D9690F93106745A4ABE845EF560F57CD.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

A8AFD0A169F74B8FA0785EEF55251242.description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes

F30311CBBCB94863943C47D911626D1E.description: Use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation when presenting.

D9FBCBFFE8CC4A1B91C09B555617BF5A.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

3A91E60BA0B04793BED41D6FB3E6BDD7.description: Interpret information presented in a variety of media and formats and explain how it contributes to a topic, text.

7DD266DE41254E3FA0029216D274A503.description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

509DA365939F48229AC53F44A478DED2.description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

2C776C187EC84D0EAFDF580DF68BF599.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions and define individual roles as needed.

FF756A7B6CCE46D1A8559A95D6220277.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material.

19A7DF74A8C24990A4245CF0F04A6748.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 6 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

8A4C0224376246449C7BB6CE21E67920.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

83422F8FC72648F6A74784CBD66147C3.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

6E2F95A9A3B14494BED4410FCB944E9F.description: Identify figurative language in context including but not limited to personification, simile, metaphor, and oxymoron.

06A1A904D10242A1944274C891A3D96D.description: Identify figurative language, word relationships, analogies, and nuances in word meanings based on grade 6 reading and content.

1D5C4F80165E41D9B1B1C63EBB160387.description: Verification of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the meaning in context or in a dictionary).

454A3B2A104C413DA59AD37A6B6DB022.description: Use of dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

47A92F2A51154FEE8DA7CA9A991D13C9.description: Use of common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

4DFDA7EEE6F84CFA8849D6B13AA63928.description: Use of context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase. For example, analyze the word’s position, part of speech, or function in a sentence to determine specific meaning of the word and how it contributes to the meaning of the sentence or paragraph.

F3D572CAF65543B9AC295B94BDF13823.description: Use the following strategies to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 6 reading and content.  Clarification: explicit instruction of the strategies and their application is required.

47D1D7A385C8438F989B5A0F6ED6AF11.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

F98A2340ACE3495AB8344C0BF10D8831.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style

E414F7FC121E4AB9BC2DF8DC0CA70EE7.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing or speaking.

A7A851AE977747D4B2528E623A3314B1.description: Use of correct spelling through editing and revision.

A4CBA421184D43DFACE0713CFDF978CD.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

A6EE9AD72BD346839F78376E3373C88B.description: Demonstrate use of the conventions of standard English punctuation when writing for a variety of purposes and audiences.

3203B3FB325346279D475E941FD3C5E0.description: Recognize variations from standard English in writing and speaking; i.e. slang, regional dialect and usage, and word differences.

C6F21D806734485CB6E8326F1DA6BD9E.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

A7DAE21CF9834C55940A657F2DE75D41.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

7F934B8030654E648ECE3FA85F58C4B8.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

4D9FA6ADAA784178A5B27644DB62B9A3.description: Demonstrate use of the following conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

31E9A4A225044176AFF941CFAC44C43C.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences  including for enjoyment and self-expression.

21CFB1F83B8341D79CC99099CD21737B.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.                                                                                                                            Clarification 1: Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics”). Clarification 2: Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

0E0A1959CA8D46E4BC71CEB95F641ACF.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding academic dishonesty, and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

F98B49BAE51A4A9ABCFF9D181EB630AB.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

50C49561E47B4A2EACC373324ECBC0FE.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3082E28C630740D4A3E70C3854F8849E.description: Use technology tools, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

BA127DA400A144B58E25FE9A6BCE028B.description: With guidance and support from teachers, peers and digital resources, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

E2662EFD7B1D425798EC28F4F4A49C66.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

2B33C51E15B74565B84CD2AED2AF74B6.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. Clarification 1:  Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. Clarification 2: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another. Clarification 4: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events. Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

F280F17288D54D038FF9ED9BF8C41DBF.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.  Clarification 2: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples. Clarification 3: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts. Clarification 4: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic. Clarification 5: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 6: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

8143A45717084894B6057C3FBE6EF8FD.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. Clarification 1: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly. Clarification 2: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text. Clarification 3: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons. Clarification 4: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 5: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

2208F3B2E34C4BACA1823E9172E3442F.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

B8145E653F134F9386DCA15C794844DC.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

FE59D77C40D549A7BC5705A759C3D668.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

C3F69AE82EDB41A7A5F4F8E2328D506B.description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a text to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the same text, for example contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

1617900E79474A54A72701A71BB9AED8.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

A9FED39915174052967314466F7F64B1.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

177E8F7DB87841E5ABC30C090BBE5B6C.description: Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

620D0713BAC24DF2A0D92AD6B40F9B32.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings.

7EDF202F80264DAFA3D2701BCFC41721.description: Summarize a given text including theme, conflict, and resolution that is distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

69C95524D5904C318FAA8B86929B2196.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details.

BD5385BC4F1643CF9F59D5D79B68CD9E.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

A2B4DC82539748DCAFE54667539227E4.description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

7C2946F26BAC4847A5527996E184F4A7.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction text complexity band proficiently at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

B10F94CB310D43EF9E8F6B0734ED3C31.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A96E6BEBD6B143CEB6D7BD176489D97A.description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

7A212118E3434A428EEE5C9F0116041C.description: Evaluate the connection of an argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

87F4820706064632BE0C049CEC04DF91.description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

12EEE53CC1CE47ECA62FC5D71DA85ED2.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

C2B4770AEB6B47BF87E942BE0FA7DEBE.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

7CF43EF081664FB6BA60BD9A649F8D36.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

D496DE431EB445979A81D72ADB4170B6.description: Summarize of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

A0645324E43C48E6BA2D07D1A5E46E2D.description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

15DDDCBED7A747219FB74DB9974F9DF4.description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details.

E9E5C62922454047BED8CBEAD0C3A5B3.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
